Maybe I'm out of the loop, but is Jiro Asada an actual authority on 
the Shinsengumi?  I know he wrote Mibugishiden, but that's like 
saying Tom Clancy is a counter-terrorism expert because he wrote 
Rainbow Six.  Other than research for his book, is he any more 
knowledgeable than the next guy?

Anyone have a link for the event, especially the San Francisco one?  

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@h...> 
wrote:
> good and BAD news...the speaker on sept 9 will be Jiro Asada who 
wrote
> Mibugishiden...now for the bad news...no translator...S. 
California is
> home to a huge population of Japanese Americans not to mention 
major
> universities with Japanese language dept.  if you are upset then 
so am
> I!!! I have PERSONALLY encouraged JAL to hire a translator for Mr.
> Asada because as a native of CA I know that many anime fansubs are
> from these universities.  So I was outraged that JAL would send Mr.
> Asada here without a translator.  The lady on the line said that 
she
> will speak to her superiors about getting a translator for Mr. 
Asada
> 
> For the S. CA (Torrance) lecture you can only pay with personal 
check
> or money order over the phone and tickets will be mailed to you 
ASAP...
> ...furthermore there will be a second lecture again by Jiro Asada 
in
> San Francisco on Sept 10 call (415) 765-8545 at the Palo Alto Hotel
> but the focus will be more on the Bakumatsu.
> 
> --- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "bsher213" <bsher213@b...> wrote:
> > I just stumbled across this on a SHisnengumi LJ community I just 
found
> > 
> > 
> > Shinsengumi to Sono Jidai' (Shinsengumi and Their Times)
> > Sept. 9, 2004 - 7:00pm at the Torrance Marriott
> > contact JAL's LA branch at (310)607-2330 for info.
> > 
> > I know we  have Californians out there---Someone has to go and 
bring
> > us back information and pictures!!!
> > 
> > Barb Sheridan
